titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: & I left the Castle about 9:30 a.m., and motored to Peel on the Wall. There we were joined by M

, a tall lad of 15. We walked along the Wall as far as Borcovicus, examining it with some care. We lunched en route, and then motored to Rock Hall, Alnwick, where we had arranged to spend the night as M
's guests. On the way, we called at Wallington, and found
at home. While he was showing us the house, of which he is justly proud, his wife arrived together with
. We continued our journey, & arrived at Rock Hall in good time for dinner.
was the daughter of Thomas Hodgkin, the historian, and is herself a Quaker. The family consists of 2 sons and 4 daughters.
is an accomplished scholar and antiquary. He farms his ancestral acres, & pursues his favourite studies. The whole aspect of their household pleased me.
